info.title: SmartCollection
info.description:
A smart collection is a grouping of products defined by rules that are set by the merchant. Shopify automatically changes the contents of a smart collection based on the rules. Smart collections, like other types of collections, are used to break down the catalog of products into categories and make the shop easier to browse.

By default, a store can have up to 5000 smart collections.

The Collect resource is used to connect a product to a smart collection. However, these collects can't be added or removed from the API as they're managed by the rules of the smart collection.

{{ '/api/reference/smart-collection.png' | image }}

You can use the CustomCollection resource to work with collections where each product in the collection is manually chosen by the merchant.

paths.description: Retrieves a list of smart collections. Note: As of version 2019-10, this endpoint implements pagination by using links that are provided in the response header. To learn more, see Make paginated requests to the REST Admin API.
paths.summary: Retrieves a list of smart collections

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Show only certain fields, specified by a comma-separated list of field names.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: Filter results by smart collection handle.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Show only the smart collections specified by a comma-separated list of IDs.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results to show.

parameters.name: product_id
parameters.description: Show smart collections that includes the specified product.

parameters.name: published_at_max
parameters.description: Show smart collections published before this date. (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)

parameters.name: published_at_min
parameters.description: Show smart collections published after this date. (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)

parameters.name: published_status
parameters.description: Filter results based on the published status of smart collections.

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Restrict results to after the specified ID.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Show smart collections with the specified title.

parameters.name: updated_at_max
parameters.description: Show smart collections last updated before this date. (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)

parameters.name: updated_at_min
parameters.description: Show smart collections last updated after this date. (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)

200.description: Retrieves a list of smart collections

x-examples.name: Retrieve a list of all smart collections

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/smart_collections.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::SmartCollection.all(
  session: test_session,
)

x-examples.name: Retrieve a list all smart collections after a specified ID

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/smart_collections.json?since_id=482865238" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::SmartCollection.all(
  session: test_session,
  since_id: "482865238",
)

-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(

ShopifyAPI::SmartCollection.all(

x-examples.name: Retrieve a list of specific smart collections

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/smart_collections.json?ids=482865238%2C1063001348" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,

ShopifyAPI::SmartCollection.all(
  session: test_session,
  ids: "482865238,1063001348",

paths.description: Creates a new smart collection using the specified rules.

x-examples.name: Create a smart collection with a specified title

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"smart_collection":{"title":"Macbooks","rules":[{"column":"vendor","relation":"equals","condition":"Apple"}]}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/smart_collections.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

smart_collection = ShopifyAPI::SmartCollection.new(session: test_session)
smart_collection.title = "Macbooks"
smart_collection.rules = [
  {
    "column" => "vendor",
    "relation" => "equals",
    "condition" => "Apple"
  }
]
smart_collection.save!

x-examples.name: Create a new smart collection with an image that will be downloaded by Shopify

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"smart_collection":{"title":"Macbooks","rules":[{"column":"vendor","relation":"equals","condition":"Apple"}],"image":{"src":"http://example.com/rails_logo.gif","alt":"Rails Logo"}}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/smart_collections.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

x-examples.name: Create a new smart collection with a base64 encoded image

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"smart_collection":{"title":"Macbooks","rules":[{"column":"vendor","relation":"equals","condition":"Apple"}],"image":{"attachment":"R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==\n","alt":"iPod"}}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/smart_collections.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

x-examples.name: Creating a smart collection without a title will return an error

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"smart_collection":{"body":"foobar","rules":[{"column":"vendor","relation":"equals","condition":"Apple"}]}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/smart_collections.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

smart_collection = ShopifyAPI::SmartCollection.new(session: test_session)
smart_collection.body = "foobar"
smart_collection.rules = [
  {
    "column" => "vendor",
    "relation" => "equals",
    "condition" => "Apple"
  }
]
smart_collection.save!

x-examples.name: Create a smart collection of all products starting with the specified term

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"smart_collection":{"title":"IPods","rules":[{"column":"title","relation":"starts_with","condition":"iPod"}]}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/smart_collections.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

smart_collection = ShopifyAPI::SmartCollection.new(session: test_session)
smart_collection.title = "IPods"
smart_collection.rules = [
  {
    "column" => "title",
    "relation" => "starts_with",
    "condition" => "iPod"
  }
]
smart_collection.save!

x-examples.name: Create a new unpublished smart collection

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"smart_collection":{"title":"Macbooks","rules":[{"column":"vendor","relation":"equals","condition":"Apple"}],"published":false}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/smart_collections.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

smart_collection = ShopifyAPI::SmartCollection.new(session: test_session)
smart_collection.title = "Macbooks"
smart_collection.rules = [
  {
    "column" => "vendor",
    "relation" => "equals",
    "condition" => "Apple"
  }
]
smart_collection.published = false
smart_collection.save!

-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

ShopifyAPI::SmartCollection.count(

)

x-examples.name: Publish a hidden collection

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"smart_collection":{"id":482865238,"published":true}}' \
-X PUT "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/smart_collections/482865238.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

smart_collection = ShopifyAPI::SmartCollection.new(session: test_session)
smart_collection.id = 482865238
smart_collection.published = true
smart_collection.save!

-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \

curl -d '{"smart_collection":{"id":482865238,"body_html":"

5000 songs in your pocket

"}}' \ -X PUT "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/smart_collections/482865238.json" \ -H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \ -H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session( auth_header: request.auth_header, cookies: request.cookies, ) smart_collection = ShopifyAPI::SmartCollection.new(session: test_session) smart_collection.id = 482865238 smart_collection.body_html = "

5000 songs in your pocket

" smart_collection.save!

x-examples.name: Hide a published smart collection

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"smart_collection":{"id":482865238,"published":false}}' \
-X PUT "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/smart_collections/482865238.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

smart_collection = ShopifyAPI::SmartCollection.new(session: test_session)
smart_collection.id = 482865238
smart_collection.published = false
smart_collection.save!

x-examples.name: Remove a smart collection

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X DELETE "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/smart_collections/482865238.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::SmartCollection.delete(
  session: test_session,

properties.description: The description of the smart collection. Includes HTML markup. Many shop themes display this on the smart collection page.
properties.name: body_html

properties.description: A human-friendly unique string for the smart collection. Automatically generated from the title. Used in shop themes by the Liquid templating language to refer to the smart collection. (maximum: 255 characters)
properties.name: handle

properties.description: The ID of the smart collection.
properties.name: id

properties.description:
The image associated with the smart collection. Valid values:

  • attachment: An image attached to a smart collection returned as Base64-encoded binary data.
  • src: A URL that specifies the location of the image.
  • alt: Alternative text that describes the collection image.
properties.name: image

properties.description: The date and time (ISO 8601 format) that the smart collection was published. Returns null when the collection is hidden.
properties.name: published_at

properties.description:
Whether the smart collection is published to the Point of Sale channel. Valid values:
  • web: The smart collection is published to the Online Store channel but not published to the Point of Sale channel.
  • global: The smart collection is published to both the Online Store channel and the Point of Sale channel.
properties.name: published_scope

properties.description:
The list of rules that define what products go into the smart collection. Each rule has the following properties:

  • column: The property of a product being used to populate the smart collection.

    Valid values for text relations:

    • title: The product title.
    • type: The product type.
    • vendor: The name of the product vendor.
    • variant_title: The title of a product variant.

    Valid values for number relations:

    • variant_compare_at_price: The compare price.
    • variant_weight: The weight of the product.
    • variant_inventory: The inventory stock. Note: not_equals does not work with this property.
    • variant_price: product price.

    Valid values for an equals relation:

    • tag: A tag associated with the product.

  • relation: The relationship between the column choice, and the condition.

    Valid values for number relations:

    • greater_than The column value is greater than the condition.
    • less_than The column value is less than the condition.
    • equals The column value is equal to the condition.
    • not_equals The column value is not equal to the condition.

    Valid values for text relations:

    • equals: Checks if the column value is equal to the condition value.
    • not_equals: Checks if the column value is not equal to the condition value.
    • starts_with: Checks if the column value starts with the condition value.
    • ends_with: Checks if the column value ends with the condition value.
    • contains: Checks if the column value contains the condition value.
    • not_contains: Checks if the column value does not contain the condition value.

  • condition: Select products for a smart collection using a condition. Values are either strings or numbers, depending on the relation value.
properties.name: rules

properties.description:
Whether the product must match all the rules to be included in the smart collection. Valid values:
  • true: Products only need to match one or more of the rules to be included in the smart collection.
  • false: Products must match all of the rules to be included in the smart collection.
properties.name: disjunctive

properties.description:
The order of the products in the smart collection. Valid values:

  • alpha-asc: The products are sorted alphabetically from A to Z.
  • alpha-des: The products are sorted alphabetically from Z to A.
  • best-selling: The products are sorted by number of sales.
  • created: The products are sorted by the date they were created, from oldest to newest.
  • created-desc: The products are sorted by the date they were created, from newest to oldest.
  • manual: The products are manually sorted by the shop owner.
  • price-asc: The products are sorted by price from lowest to highest.
  • price-desc: The products are sorted by price from highest to lowest.
properties.name: sort_order

properties.description: The suffix of the Liquid template that the shop uses. By default, the original template is called product.liquid, and additional templates are called product.suffix.liquid.
properties.name: template_suffix

properties.description: The name of the smart collection. Maximum length: 255 characters.
properties.name: title

properties.description: The date and time (ISO 8601 format) when the smart collection was last modified.
properties.name: updated_at

x-shopify-meta.meta_description: Create or update smart collections by defining selection conditions. Products that match the conditions are included in the collection automatically.
